reviews.review: 确实好玩，总是逼玩家换一个角度思考，对空间思维和逻辑思维都是不错的收获

Portal is a very successful experiment in using the Half-Life 2 Source engine to create a puzzle game in which you use a gun that creates 2 portals that are connected is space. The game does an excellent job in explaining these mechanics, and it's very enjoyable through it's short campaign. There isn't much of a story, but GLaDOS is an iconic figure through the entire game. The game is also generally easy-medium. There's also 6 additional advanced chambers (medium-hard) and 18 challenges (hard-very hard). To complete these, you'll need to learn some tricks. But these are mainly for those who want to master this game, and it's a nice addition. But i easily recommend you to play the story, and in the end you'll want more, which Portal 2 delivers.

My Nominee for Test of TIme Award 2016.

Explaining how I feel about a game this good is a waste of time.  I can't imagine anyone into video games who has not heard of this game but has not played it on steam.  Still, I'm going to waste my time anyway.  It's pretty much the closest you can get to a perfect video game which is something I never thought I would ever say about anything I've played.

What it is is simple - a first person puzzler using the Source engine and Havoc Physics where you solve one test chamber after another until you reach the end.  Puzzles use physics, blocks, falling and thrown objects, accelleration, and falling protagonists.  This is combined with a "gun" which can be used to create entry and exit portals where you can move around the levels and  move objects around to push switches, redirect lasers and pellets, or make turrets shoot each other.

The levels are intuitively designed, challanging, and fun to play.  The challange is not borne out of frustration, instead you have all the tools you need and the game delicately reminds of what you are capable of either through the design of the stages or through a word from the antagonist.  Each puzzle gives you skills which build from one to the next, training you until you are ready for the final puzzle and the final confrontation with the antagonist.  Every part is carefully and lovingly designed without making you feel dumb or frustrated, instead you will feel accomplishment and satisfaction from discovering each solution.

The story working in the background, the empty observation rooms above you, the places you find outside the testing chambers all paint a narrative.  The game does not dwell so much on the narrative or story to the detriment of gameplay.  You can speed past it without considering it, or go so far as to investigate stories, listen to radios, and understand the complicated mess leading up to the situation you find yourself in as you do or do not desire.

The pacing is perfect, the story doesn't take up too much time, the levels and test chambers present themselves, teach you what they need to and move on without sticking around for too long, becoming too much of a nusance, or so familiar they make you uninterested in finding out anything new.

This all builds up to a finale, one you anticipate in order to discover why you are here, who is testing you and where the cake is.  It takes you outside the test chambers in order to break the system you were trapped in, something you were waiting for for so long.  Finally, you meet your antagonist face to face, confront, and defeat her until you reach the satisfying conclusion to your journey.

Being well-paced, well-written, well-designed, and tightly developed so that it remains welcome without becoming boring this is one of the better if not perfect games you can end up playing.  That is just my opinion, but it is probably the correct one.

Beat it in like an hour and a half with a piss poor story and some funny cake jokes only ran into 1 hard puzzle so youll have to get mods for it to have fun but for real this game isnt challenging for anyone with an iq of more than a potato.

Первая часть является ярчайшим представителем эксперемента в видеоиграх: изначально шла в паке, не пиарилась, на нее никто не ставил, сделана за две копейки, довольно короткая. Но за этими ограничениями родилась характерная атмосфера и даже свое микровселенная (внутри вселенной халфы). Игра держится, по сути, только на одном персонаже - ГЛАДОС. И все. Больше никого здесь нет. Вот так. К слову, не советую играть с русской озвучкой, голос передали ужасно. Это тот случай, когда субтитры гораздо более предпочтительней.
Что я еще могу сказать? Простая по своей сути головоломка (но местами сложная на деле), с парочкой отличных шуток, неожиданным поворотом, нарастающим под конец темпом и бум концовкой. Проходится на одном дыхании, как так коротковата. 
Да, по сравнению со второй частью она смотрится блекло, но давайте помнить, что без первой второй и не было бы.
Графика, звук, стиль - все очень приятное. Единственное - интерьер довольно однообразный (разве что под конец локация слегка меняется).
7 из 10

Portal is a very unique game, unlike any you have ever played before and is not like any other puzzle game out there. The portal gun they give you is insanely creative and fun to play around with, I give huge amount of credit to those programmers who figured out how to make this portal concept a reality. Second, the game makes you feel like you have control over everything. You aren't being lead into the obstacles and obvious paths that you need to take, you actually really need to figure out how to get to the next level and it is not very easy but not incredibly hard either. the portal gun gives puzzles like these a new challenge since you basically have to figure out how to use your enviornment to your advantage. The closest feeling I can compare this game to is mirrors edge. That open world feeling where you are in contron and it feels like you are actually playing a game instead of moving a character on a screen. You really forget that you are playing a game because you get so immersed at how free you feel in the game and how challenging and indirect the levels are. Portal is probably one of the best games ever, it is a simple concept with lots of room for creativity and if you have not played this game then what are you waiting for?

It's a Short but a good game. 
That feel when you need to think twice before doing some level is awesome. One of the best puzzle games that I ever played. Now... Think with portals. Because GLaDOS said.

Infinite possibilities that exist in this game out of just using 2 related portals ; is just amazing !

Annoying but funny game.

But the best part.... <3

"This was a triumph.
I'm making a note here:
HUGE SUCCESS.
It's hard to overstate my satisfaction.
Aperture Science
We do what we must because we can.
For the good of all of us.
Except the ones who are dead.

But there's no sense crying over every mistake.
You just keep on trying till you run out of cake.
And the Science gets done. And you make a neat gun.
For the people who are still alive.

I'm not even angry.
I'm being so sincere right now.
Even though you broke my heart.
And killed me.
And tore me to pieces.
And threw every piece into a fire.
As they burned it hurt because I was so happy for you!
Now these points of data make a beautiful line.
And we're out of beta. We're releasing on time.
So I'm GLaD. I got burned.
Think of all the things we learned for the people who are still alive.

One last thing:

Go ahead and leave me.
I think I prefer to stay inside.
Maybe you'll find someone else to help you.
Maybe Black Mesa...
THAT WAS A JOKE. HA HA. FAT CHANCE.
Anyway, this cake is great.
It's so delicious and moist.
Look at me still talking when there's Science to do.
When I look out there, it makes me GLaD I'm not you.
I've experiments to run.
There is research to be done.
On the people who are still alive.

And believe me I am still alive.
I’m doing Science and I’m still alive.
I feel FANTASTIC and I’m still alive.
While you’re dying I’ll be still alive.
And when you’re dead I will be still alive."

Nenapadna mala hra sa necakane objavi, ako bonus k Half Life 2 v Orange Boxe a nakoniec sa ukaze, ze ide o najlepsiu a najkreativnejsie spracovanu logicku hru s neopakovatelnym zlomyselnym humorom umelej inteligencie GLaDOS a to vsetko v putavom pribehovom pozadi? No, takto Valve proste bezne vydava svoje hry, ktore sa neskor prakticky vzdy stanu tak nejak legendami. 

Portal som dohral uz davno, ale ked uz sa mi valal v kniznici, tak som si ho po rokoch zahral znovu a on ma znovu dostal! Cely som ho dohral doslova jednym dychom a ani na chvilu nepocitoval unavu z premyslenych portalovych hadaniek.
Ak ste neni uplne blby a kazde hlbsie zamyslenie vam nesposobuje migreny, tak dnes uz Legendarny Portal proste musite hrat. Na poli logickych hier by ste asi len tazko hladali lepsieho adepta a navyse s takto perfektne premyslenymi portalovymi hratkami a neskonale vtipnymi hlaskami GLaDOS, pre ktoru ste len postradatelny testovaci subjekt.

对于传送门我也是早有耳闻，趁着打折把他买了后一直没好好玩，现在也终于通关了。
总体来说这游戏很不错，非常具有创意。比起其他的解密游戏这个游戏最大的特点就是很容易上手，让很多没接触过的玩家能够很快理解游戏该怎么玩。但这游戏看似简单但每一关都要仔细考虑才能通过。同时各个关卡也很有意思，玩过一关后就停不下来想继续玩下去。
缺点的话也很明显，首先流程太短，这点有些可惜。
其次就是V社游戏一贯的问题，当然这个问题可能只是对我而言是个问题吧。那就是从半条命2开始v社的游戏都给人一种很诡异的感觉。就拿传送门来说，明明是款解密游戏但游戏的环境却总让我觉得很阴森，可能跟主角从来不说话有关吧，不知其他人是否跟我有一样的感觉。

In all the years I've been on Steam, I had never come within miles of any of Valve's own games, including "Portal." Having played a lot of action games the past several months, I felt "Portal" would be something different to enjoy. And boy is it something different indeed. I did have fun playing it for being different, because it's a puzzle game as much as it is an action game. And it was worth playing through because it's humor ensures it doesn't get boring at all.

Using Valve's Source Engine, the graphics in this game are very nice. The environments look very nice, the Aperture Science Labs are very well designed, they look like a laboratory designed by Apple. This environment really draws you in, cause you don't know what could be lying in the next room, what kind of "tests" that were designed for you. 

The gameplay is unique indeed. The Portal Gun really takes puzzle solving to new dimensions. You have to literally think outside the box to try and figure out how to use this device to solve the puzzles and to get to new heights. I was amazed by how Valve was able to make the portals work in this game, allowing to be able to get from one part of the room to another seamlessly without requiring much technical effort on the game's end. It's very well executed. Though my only complaint is trying to keep track of which portal (Orange or Blue) is where. The Tests are also well designed, intended to be challenging, yet give you the freedom to decide how you want to solve them. Test Chamber 17 was the most memorable for me (I miss you Weighted Companion Cube! *sniff*.) 

The other notable thing about this game is the voice acting. The game features Ellen McLain as GLaDOS, the omnipetent A.I. who monitors your progress. GLaDOS is a very memorable character whose auto-tuned computer voice brings out humor in practically every line she says. The comedy in this game reminds me of Coen Brothers movies. I also found it hard to keep a straight face at the turret voices (also done by McLain.) The turrets sound so sweet, innocent, and nonthreatening, you cannot help but take a moment to pause and laugh. 

I also liked how the game avoids exposition in it's plot. The player character, Chell, has no voice, but she doesn't need one, because this game does a better job putting you in the driver's seat, making the plot unfold before you. It makes the plot less predictable at times and gives it some realism. Showing the player what's going on and not telling them anything, and overall, letting them discover for themselves, it makes for a more immersive experience.

I have a few complaints about this game, though. My least favorite parts were the jumping segments, where you had to fall down through a portal to get enough speed to soar over walls or to get up to higher heights. I hate them because the portals are never in the correct spot where you'll end up falling. You have little control when you're in freefall. I also disliked some instances where I came through the portal and was upside down, and was distracting and disorienting, especially if I ended up needing to pay attention to what's in front of me. And again, I completed this game in less than three hours, which is a common complaint. But for that, that's what the game does to make you want to come back and play it again someday, cause there are many ways to solve all the tests and play it several times over.

This game was a really good ride. A shame it was as short as it is, but that's what makes you want to come back and try again, cause you'll likely have thought up new ways to solve the tests. The gameplay is simple enough that first-time players will not have a hard time learning, and returning players will be able to use their experience to think up new ways to play. The voice acting is excellent, the humor is enough to make you pause and laugh. And the game really immerses you in the perspective of the player character and does a great job of using "show, not tell." The game does have it's problems, but they do not detract from the experience. If I need something to pass the time, this game will definitely be on my list to do just that. I intend to play this again.
What is not to love about this game? It has interesting puzzles, great humor and cake!

Hoje em dia, em que a comunidade gamer preza por complexidade, seja ela de mecânicas ou de enredo, Portal surpreende por mostrar que com mecânicas simples e um enredo minimalista é possível criar um jogo sensacionalmente imersivo e divertido. 

Tentarei fazer uma análise sem [i]major spoilers[/i] porque detesto encontrar descrições de personagens ou de momentos quando estou lendo análises.

[u]Jogabilidade[/u]
Neste quesito, Portal surpreende principalmente pela imersão que oferece aos jogadores, ainda que estejamos controlando uma protagonista que não tem falas, que não sabemos nada sobre, e que só podemos ver com o advento dos portais que usamos no jogo. É fácil se perder no tempo entre os puzzles, testando novas possibilidades e interações com o ambiente.
Os portais são mecanismos incrivelmente simples e simultaneamente muito complexos, visto que as possibilidades de uso são inúmeras e o jogo faz com que você explore isso. Para fazer com que os portais funcionem bem, a física do jogo tem de ser boa, e neste quesito Portal não deixa a desejar. Os controles respondem muito bem e a ambientação, por mais minimalista que seja, atende bem às demandas do jogo.

[u]Enredo[/u]
Portal faz muito, usando muito pouco. O enredo é simples, mas satisfatório. A única personagem falante do jogo é uma das personagens mais hilárias que eu já encontrei em todos os jogos que já joguei, rendendo gargalhadas após gargalhadas.

[u]Dificuldade[/u]
Levando em conta a campanha principal, Portal só apresenta um desafio realmente empolgante, exigindo estratégia e habilidade, na segunda metade do jogo, e ainda assim, não é nada que alguns segundos de raciocínio ou testes de tentativa e erro não resolvam. 
O jogo não é muito difícil principalmente porque as fases só têm uma solução (com uma variação mínima), então geralmente quando você termina uma parte do puzzle, fica bem óbvio qual é a próxima parte a ser resolvida. Para mim isto é um ponto fraco, já que Portal tem uma mecânica que te instiga a procurar novas possibilidades, mas ainda assim a resposta vai ter de ser sempre a mesma.
É um jogo com um potencial de dificuldade beirando o infinito, e infelizmente o jogo te oferece pouquíssimas fases pra ter de exercitar a mente.

[u]Soundtrack[/u]
Muito pouco memorável, mas coerente com o enredo do jogo. Definitivamente poderia ser melhor mas mesmo assim ela se apresenta de forma satisfatória. A música dos créditos é S-E-N-S-A-C-I-O-N-A-L.

[u]Duração[/u]
Minha carteira me pressiona a dizer que R$19,99 por ~5 horas de gameplay da campanha principal é um preço bem salgado, mas se eu soubesse o quanto o jogo é fascinante, eu pagaria tranquilamente. 
A duração, infelizmente, é muito pequena. Eu estava tão imerso no jogo que achei que ainda estava jogando o tutorial quando o jogo acabou (ainda que ser semelhante a um tutorial não fuja do propósito do jogo), e me recusei a acreditar que tinha acabado porque o jogo era tão bom e tinha durado tão pouco.
Em relação ao conteúdo pós-endgame, você tem algumas das fases da campanha principal, mas abordadas de formas mais complexas, com recursos limitados e com uma avaliação de performance no final. O fator de replay do jogo base fica prejudicado por esta repetitividade, mas existem mods e fases criadas no editor de níveis para manter a diversão.

[u]Conclusão[/u]
Portal é uma pérola dos jogos modernos, mostrando para a indústria que é possível fazer diferente, que é possível pensar fora da caixinha, fugir dos clichés e chavões que vêm sendo martelados na nossa cabeça jogo após jogo. Uma das melhores experiências em termos de videogames que eu já tive na minha vida.

9,5/10

After playing Portal on my brother's computer I was convinced to get a Steam account so I could get Portal.  I enjoy the sarcastic computer GLaDOS, the "Still Alive" song, and playing a puzzle game.  The cake for my retirement party included the phrase "The cake is a lie," only one other person caught the reference.  An all around great game.
Portal is one of those games you can finish in an afternoon. Its very quick but also very enjoyable. I recommend this game, along with portal 2, because the story and concept in whole is very fun.
melhor que mulher

I just bought and completed this game. Never played it before. Never really looked at it that much either. I guess I am not that interested into popular games. I find them quite boring way too often, and also too expensive.

But I just realised this one is popular for good reasons... and it's also cheap.

The puzzles all have an easy goal: make you learn something.
You will complete it fast, but you will have fun, a lot of it.
Also big thumbs up for the end because I think it was one of the coolest ending I've ever experienced in a video game.

Portal is already almost 9 years old and yet I still never played anything like it. 
Very innovative and unique and will still be worth playing for years.

The only thing that bothered me really was the loading screens. They are slow. But they aren't so many so yeah: It deserves a great 9/10.

Замечательная игра!
Интересная, затягивающая, заставляет подумать над головоломками, головокружительная, в прямом смысле этого слова. Когда первый раз прыгнул с высоты в портал на полу, а вылетел со стены под потолком, голова кругом пошла, чуть с дивана не упал... Непередаваемое ощущение! 
Рекомендую всем! Своеобразная тренировка вестибулярного аппарата.
Ставлю 10 из 10!
One of the best puzzle games ever made!

As a player who decides what games to buy based on the reviews of the certain game, it's my duty to write a complete review about any game i finish, so here is my review:

PORTAL:

When i got the bundle for 3,74€ i was like "Meh, what's so special about this game that everyone online talks about? Something about a cake....".
When i played the game, finished it, while i was sitting in my chair listening to the credits song, i was thinking to myself: "This is probably the best game i will ever play". I was sad because i didn't enjy it as much as i should.
A puzzle game, second best from my opinion, with a very good storyline, very fun monologs from the GLaDOS, an Artificial Inteligence program who runs the Aperture Science Facilities, gives you the portal gun and always insults you in the mist clever ways i have ever heard.
You have the portal gun, open portals to play and survive from the puzzles that GLaDOS puts you through.

Before i procceed with the PROS and CONS i would like to remind anyone who is reading this that these are my personal preferences and may differ by any individual who plays the game.

PROS:
+A very fun, challenging and unique experience.
+The puzzles are very good designed with sometimes more than one solutions.
+Different levels, different options, different difficulties.

CONS:
-Didn't buy it later

TL;DR The second best Puzzle game i have ever played, the first being "Portal 2", and i wish i could play it again for the first time.

10/10 Gabe you don't make many games, but the games you make are masterpieces, keep going!!
